description: 共同科英文（二）課程為一學期兩學分課程，係為非英語系學生所開設的課程。目標在幫助大一學生活用中學時期所累積的英語知識，提昇英語聽、說、讀、寫整體的溝通能力。為達此目標，本課程要求教師盡量用英語上課，努力營造一個豐富的英語環境，讓學生不但有充分機會以英語參與課堂活動，且樂於使用英語與同學及老師溝通。
goals: 1. 增進學生英語溝通表達能力 2. 透過參與課程活動促進團隊精神 3. 透過多面向英語閱讀促使學生了解多元文化，拓展學生國際化視野 4. 透過課堂討論培養批判精神 5. 提升學生英語學習動機及自主學習興趣

**Course Description and Objectives:**

This general English course is designed to enhance students’ reading, writing, listening and speaking skills. Students will be offered the opportunity to develop these 4 language skills along with critical thinking skills by presenting them with ideas from all over the world.

**Requirements & Grading policy:**

*   **Attendance and Participation 20%**

Punctual attendance and active participation are required. Participation also includes teamwork and group projects.

If you are habitually late or absent, points will be deducted and you may fail this course. Exceptions are allowed only under emergent circumstances or notification in advance. Please inform me in advance through email if you will not be able to attend the class.

*   **3-minute presentation 20%**

Prepare a 3-minute presentation talking about any topic that you are interested in. Prepare at most 5 power point slides for your presentation.

*   **Video presentation 20%**

Select a topic that you want to introduce to your classmates and find an English video to help you introduce the idea. Prepare a 10-minute presentation and make sure that you select something (related to English) from the video to teach to your classmates (words, idioms, culture, etc.).

*   **Short essays 10%**

Write two short essays (at least 250 words) based on the topics assigned.

Submit your essays through Moodle before the assigned due day (Check the schedule). **LATE ASSIGNMENTS WILL NOT BE ACCEPTED.**

*   **Unit Quiz 10%**

The unit quiz will mainly focus on the reading text of the unit. Each group will complete the quiz together.

*   **Oral Test 20%**

Choose a book with your reading partner and both of you should read it. Prepare a 5-minute discussion about the book. The discussion could be about your likes/dislikes about the book, how you feel after reading the book, what you have learned from the book, the things/events the book reminds you of, etc. It is strongly suggested that both of you discuss what you are going to talk about in the test and practice beforehand.
